Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether a hearing was required under procedural fairness given insufficient evidence of sexual orientation
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s.113, Regulations s.167
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant claimed risk in Jamaica due to being openly lesbian; PRRA officer rejected application due to lack of evidence supporting sexual orientation
Crimes.Court_Ruling: No error made by PRRA officer; no hearing required
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: PRRA officer assessed application on paper without oral hearing
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk of persecution due to sexual orientation in Jamaica
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Requirement of a hearing when there is a serious credibility issue affecting the decision
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Sufficiency of evidence versus credibility assessment
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA s.113, s.167 of the Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Absence of oral hearing during PRRA
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No adverse credibility finding; issue was evidentiary insufficiency
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Counsel's statement regarding applicant’s sexual orientation
Crimes.Application_Basis: Insufficient corroborative evidence of sexual orientation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Lack of documentation or testimony proving sexual orientation
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Protection from removal based on risk due to sexual orientation
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Hearing required only if serious credibility issue exists
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to provide sufficient evidence of sexual orientation
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm in Jamaica due to sexual orientation not established
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant failed to provide sufficient corroborative evidence beyond counsel's assertion
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Decision based on documentary record without oral submission
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient independent evidence to establish sexual orientation
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Applicant had permanent resident status prior to criminal inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Focus on sufficiency rather than truthfulness
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No hearing mandated where decision turns on insufficient evidence, not credibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of objective evidence supporting identity-based claim
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Serious issue of credibility triggering right to hearing

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Inadmissibility and deportation based on criminal conviction
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Whether failure to hold an oral hearing violated procedural fairness
Crimes.Evidence_Disclosure_Status: Not applicable – decision based on existing criminal record
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: PRRA application rejected; removal order upheld
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Conviction for drug trafficking leading to loss of permanent resident status
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issue: Sufficiency of evidence on sexual orientation claim in PRRA context
Crimes.Procedural_Requirement: Potential need for oral hearing in PRRA where credibility is at issue
Crimes.Risk_Nexus: Claimed risk upon return to Jamaica due to sexual orientation
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Serious credibility issue requiring hearing under procedural fairness
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: Insufficient evidence of sexual orientation, not adverse credibility
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA framework on inadmissibility and protection claims
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Denial: Serious criminality due to drug trafficking conviction
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No negative finding; deficiency in evidence quantity, not truthfulness
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issues: Alleged denial of fair process through lack of oral hearing
Crimes.Risk_Assessment_Factors: Persecution risk based on sexual orientation in Jamaica
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Oral hearing not held during PRRA process
Crimes.Risk_Persecution: Claimed fear of persecution as a lesbian in Jamaica
Crimes.Mode_of_Entry: Lawful permanent resident prior to conviction
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Interplay between criminal inadmissibility and protection claims
Crimes.Relevant_Factors_Considered: Nature of crime, evidence of sexual orientation, country conditions
